content.description: Same start as 3D but head right through a small crack system and very small roof.  Pull through on crimps, and work your way up a large crack.  You will pass a tree on your way up.  Once you get to the tree it's easier slab climbing to the top.
content.protection: Very small nuts and cams for the bottom.  Easy to protect up top with a mixture of gear.  Top rope.
content.location: Route is on the right side of the Main Wall.  Climbs to the right of the large overhang through the notch with a  tree.  Walk off either side of the crag or rap down.

content.description: Face climbing with sloping holds and a few horizonal cracks near the top.
content.protection: Can be climbed trad but most top rope.  You will need extra webing to top rope from the trees above.  The trees sit back about 10-15' back.
content.location: Starts on the face just left of the roof about half way up.

content.description: Begin at the base of a large, right-facing corner.  Climb up the left side of the left face.  A little contrived but might be a good climb for a beginner.  5.5 rating may be a little high.
content.location: Where the Main Wall and the Right Sector connect.

content.description: Start at the block sticking out from under the right side of the low roof.  Balance up to a stance on the block, step left and climb up the ramp to a good horizontal crack.  Crank up and lunge to the second horizontal crack, then continue to the top on easier slab.
content.protection: Trad or top rope.  No anchors at the top.
content.location: This route is in the center of the Main Face.  Start from the block.  You can walk off either side of the cliff or rap back to the base.

content.description: Getting off the ground is the crux.
content.protection: This can be climbed trad with some care but most top rope this area.  You will need extra webing to set up a top rop from the trees on top.
content.location: Start about 15 feet right.  Climb the broken, left facing corner to the face above.

content.description: - head up Green Duchess to first horiz. crack and traverse left to end of horizontal crack   - work up to second horizontal crack and traverse all way to right
- starts below largest roof on wall   - crux is low overhang roof which leads to middle of second largest roof   - follow horizontal buckets out and up face above
content.location: - near right end of the Main Wall area

content.description: Begin in the broken crack system just right of a large "nose."  Boulder your way through pockets and crimps to a nice rail.  Make a few more moves to easier ground above.  This climb gets right into the action at the beginning.  One of the best routes for the grade in the area.
content.protection: .5-2" gear. Walk of top or rap of the trees.
content.location: Starts in the main crack just to the right of The Dish.

content.description: Starts below an obvious overhang on the right side of the wall.  There will also be a tree behind you when you are on the route.  Begin on small holds and liebacks until you reach the roof.  Take a good test and begin working crimps and pinches to pull the roof.  Make use of a knee bar under the roof.  Finding feet over the roof is the crux of the route.  Once over the roof follow easier moves to the top.
content.protection: Small to medium size cams or top rope.
content.location: On the right end of the Main Wall below a large overhang.

content.description: This is the most prominent face at the crag.  Make sure you bring a static line or long webbing for setting up the top rope.  All of the trees and boulders are located around twenty feet from the cliff top.  The routes on the Main Wall stay very clean with little to no water runoff on this section of the crag.  Bring you beta finding skills for classics like Coordination Street (5.10a) or Green Duchess (5.11b/c).  Lack of natural gear placements make top roping the normal on this wall.
